alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 10:08AM CST until January 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Big Nance Creek AT Courtland affecting Lawrence County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Nance Creek AT Courtland. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins on the left bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Monday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CST Monday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 01/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM CST.
